page.title: 09HOUSING
page.content: Housing is varied, with the oldest house dating from the sixteenth century to small developments of new private housing.Many council houses are being bought by tenants;there are on average twice as many home owners as tenants.Houses are kept in good order with many people 'do-it-yourself enthusiasts,often building extensions rather than moving.Loft and wall insulation & double glazing are common.Village centres only tend to be on main drainage. {Energy.}Most houses are centrally heated using oil,wood,coal,bottled gas & electricity.A few have solar heating.The gas mains to Ashford pass on the west side of the A20.but to which neither village has been connected.
